import Mathlib

/-- Let U âŠ‚ â„^n be open and let f : U â†’ â„ be differentiable. Show that if f is convex on U, then for all x,y âˆˆ U and t âˆˆ [0,1], f(tx+(1-t)y) â‰¤ t f(x) + (1-t) f(y). -/
theorem convex_on_convex_comb_le {n : Nat} {U : Set (Fin n â†’ â„)} {f : (Fin n â†’ â„) â†’ â„}
  (hU : IsOpen U) (hd : DifferentiableOn â„ f U) (hconv : ConvexOn U f) :
  âˆ€ x y, x âˆˆ U â†’ y âˆˆ U â†’ âˆ€ t : â„, t âˆˆ Set.Icc (0 : â„) 1 â†’ f (t â€¢ x + (1 - t) â€¢ y) â‰¤ t * f x + (1 - t) * f y := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let U âŠ‚ â„^n be open and let f : U â†’ â„ be differentiable. Show that if f is convex on U, then for all x,y âˆˆ U and t âˆˆ [0,1], f(tx+(1-t)y) â‰¤ t f(x) + (1-t) f(y). -/
theorem convex_on_convex_comb_le {n : Nat} {U : Set (Fin n â†’ â„)} {f : (Fin n â†’ â„) â†’ â„}
  (hU : IsOpen U) (hd : DifferentiableOn â„ f U) (hconv : ConvexOn â„ U f) :
  âˆ€ x y, x âˆˆ U â†’ y âˆˆ U â†’ âˆ€ t : â„, t âˆˆ Set.Icc (0 : â„) 1 â†’ f (t â€¢ x + (1 - t) â€¢ y) â‰¤ t * f x + (1 - t) * f y := by sorry
